page.title: 05ANDREW RENNIE
page.content: {Andrew Rennie}was born in 1890, one of four children, in a house (now demolished) at the top of{Station Brae He remembers a very different Kippen, dirt roads and fewer people. He attended school in the{Village Hall until the age of 14 when he left to work in{The Smiddy.}For work he wore a blue flannel shirt,trousers and a leather apron split up the middle to make shoeing horses easier. Andrew was the village blacksmith for over 50 years. He enjoyed his work and described the many tasks including singeing sheep's heads for the "toffs" for broth! A smiddy was a fascinating place for the children and he often had an audience, on whom he enjoyed playing tricks! Andrew Rennie died,aged 95,just two months after coming up to school to give us his fascinating life-story.
